Articles.Content: So the feature is thrust dust?

> 
> So the feature is thrust dust?

I think it was the new intro music.

Thrust dust is very nice! I like it!

Also airbrakes.

> 
> I think it was the new intro music.

The new intro music on Das's stream wasn't in game, and was made months ago. I'm not sure if that's what you are referring to.

> 
> It could also be thumbnails for craft. This would certainly fit with the "imagine you're a new player." It's alot easier to understand what a craft is when you can see a thumbnail of it.

Thumbnails were shown before Harv mentioned the new feature. It's not that.
I believe the most long overdue feature was the "warp to" button.

> 
> I believe the most long overdue feature was the "warp to" button.

It can't be that, we heard about that one a while ago.
Not reading all 49 pages to see if this has already been said, but a part search field would really help everyone, especially new players.

Hey dusty landing and 1998 looking ocean water, no delta v reading, no PE AP outside map view ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Edit: No clouds ;/

Wonder how hard the reviewers will knock KSP for how bland it looks. I'm sure Squad must be ready for the mass influx of "where are the clouds?!" Threads. 

And the stock skybox is complete crap as well.

> 
> Wonder how hard the reviewers will knock KSP for how bland it looks. I'm sure Squad must be ready for the mass influx of "where are the clouds?!" Threads. 
> And the stock skybox is complete crap as well.

Well KSP is still really fun game/great to teach astronomy/physics and stuff and at least I am not going to review it badly for missing lots of stuff, but still makes me angry what it's missing just seeing that Space Engine for instance only uses around 1 GB RAM on my machine. :/

So much fun for space exploration ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Oh it's no problem for the established player. We all know we like the game. But to the new average Joe it's just ..."Wth is this? No clouds? And I can count the pixels in the night sky. Lol, fail."

> 
> Oh it's no problem for the established player. We all know we like the game. But to the new average Joe it's just ..."Wth is this? No clouds? And I can count the pixels in the night sky. Lol, fail."

LOL totally see it coming AAA gamer mentality ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

totally makes me laugh that we have a faster than light mod for ksp but no other star to go to.
It could be the new launch stage highlighter. I don't know if that was mentioned anywhere else.

> 
> It could be the new launch stage highlighter. I don't know if that was mentioned anywhere else.

apparently it was the dust effects.

> 
> That flying dust is just jaw dropping already. How cool that will look on the Mun.

Such things would look very different on the MÃƒÂ¼n (or any airless body) because the lack of atmosphere for the particles to hit would cause them to NOT billow into clouds...the dust would just stream out ballistically. So if Squad does try to use a billowing effect on airless workds, it will be seriously **wrong**.

I just have to say: 

OH MY GOD THEY ADDED LAUNCH SMOKE OH MY GOD OH MY GOD

Also, they may have done it better than hotrockets, as with hotrockets whenever your velocity was close to zero smoke started billowing out of your engine and it was a pain in the @$$ to see.

> 
> Such things would look very different on the MÃƒÂ¼n (or any airless body) because the lack of atmosphere for the particles to hit would cause them to NOT billow into clouds...the dust would just stream out ballistically. So if Squad does try to use a billowing effect on airless workds, it will be seriously **wrong**.

It'll go well with hearing explosions from your debris on Mun.
The nuclear engine now uses only LF like the real NTR, instead of LF+LOX. Could be that?

> 
> Such things would look very different on the MÃƒÂ¼n (or any airless body) because the lack of atmosphere for the particles to hit would cause them to NOT billow into clouds...the dust would just stream out ballistically. So if Squad does try to use a billowing effect on airless workds, it will be seriously **wrong**.

Looks like they nailed it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Enjoy Mun landing FX in [EnterElysium's YT vid](https://youtu.be/tDmJZueCK4s?t=5m23s) - no billowing clouds ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

(But, all the usual sound FX... I like 5th's point: Movies and TV get us so used to sound travelling in a vacuum, that most *(me included)* don't even notice it as a Thing that shouldn't be there, unless someone points it out.)

EDIT: the Q&A on [Reddit (link)](http://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/33uer0/landing_effects_in_10/cqomoc4?context=3)

> 
> ....The billowing clouds only appear in bodies with atmospheres. Otherwise, you just get the smaller surface wake and debris, as the dust cloud would immediately dissipate in a vacuum.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T04:00:34Z" title="04/26/2015 04:00  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by basic.syntax**

> 
> Looks like they nailed it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Indeed. A YouTube I saw shows the mÃƒÂ¼nar dust just spraying straight away. Looks good.
What does this have to do with newbies?

> 
> What does this have to do with newbies?

They'll realize that not having it is wrong, whereas veterans don't even notice it?

> 
> What does this have to do with newbies?

Watching exhaust flames spew out of either side of the launch pad? I suppose it might have concerned newbies that their KSP launches didn't look like real launches in that respect.

BUT...Has Harv confirmed that this exhaust effect is indeed the "long-overdue" feature he was talking about in this thread? Or have people just assumed that?
